{-# LANGUAGE TypeSynonymInstances #-}
{-# LANGUAGE FlexibleInstances #-}
{-# OPTIONS_HADDOCK prune #-}

{-|
Module      : Syntax
Description : Grammar for TransformeR
Copyright   : (c) Remy Wang, 2016
Maintainer  : remywang@protonmail.com 
Stability   : experimental
Portability : POSIX

Grammar for TransmormeR, with abstract and concrete syntax (the latter
defined in @Show@ instances). This is work in progress, and the final 
goal is to implement a subset of R grammar with (refinement) type 
annotations. Refer to the paper/design doc on Github for the 
definition of the grammar. 
-}

module Syntax where

import Data.List

-- ABSTRACT SYNTAX FOR TransformeR

-- | A transformation has a name, is signed by an input- 
-- and a return-data descriptor and has a body.
data Transformation = TRANS Name Sig Sig Expression
instance Show Transformation where
  show (TRANS arg tau1 tau2 e) = 
    concat [ "transform (", arg, " : ", show tau1, ")\n"
           , "        : ", show tau2, "\n"
           , " {", show e, "}"]

-- | Record-type encodes column names and their descriptors
data Sig = Sig [(Name, Descriptor)]
instance Show Sig where
  show (Sig nds) = 
    concat [ "{" 
           ,  concat . (intersperse ", ") $ map (\(n, d) -> n ++ " : " ++ show d) nds
           , "}"]

-- | expressions that can appear in the transformation body: 
-- a literal value, a field access, an operator application, 
-- a record, a variable, a field mutation, sequencing of expressions, 
-- or a variable assignment. The order might matter during pretty
-- printing (operator precedence)!

data Expression = LIT Value                     -- ^ literal value
                | PROJ Expression Field         -- ^ field access
                | OP OPR [Expression]           -- ^ operator application
                | REC [(Field, Expression)]     -- ^ record
                | VAR Name                      -- ^ variable
                | MUTATE Name Field Expression  -- ^ field mutation
                | SEQ Expression Expression     -- ^ sequencing of exps
                | ASSIGN Name Expression        -- ^ variable assignment

instance Show Expression where
  show (LIT v) = show v 
  show (PROJ e f) = concat [show e, "[", f, "]"]
  show (OP opr es) = concat [show opr, "(", (concat . intersperse ", " . map show) es, ")"]
  show (REC fes) = concat [ "{" 
                          , (concat . intersperse ", ") (map (\(f, e) -> f ++ " = " ++ show e) fes)
                          , "}"]
  show (VAR x) = x
  show (MUTATE n f e) = concat [n, "[", f, "]:=", show e]
  show (SEQ e1 e2) = show e1 ++ "; " ++ show e2 
  show (ASSIGN n e) = n ++ ":=" ++ show e 

type Field = String
type Rec = [(Name, Expression)]
-- | a descriptor encodes range
type Descriptor = Range
-- | range encodes information neccessary to infer the sensitivity (together 
-- with the DP-mechanism)
data Range = INTERVAL Number Number -- ^ currently using closed intervals for floats
           | SET [Name]             -- ^ a set of categories (bins in a histogram)
instance Show Range where
  show (INTERVAL lb ub) = concat ["N[", show lb, ", ", show ub, "]"]
  show (SET ns) = concat ["C[", concat $ (intersperse ", ") (map show ns), "]"]

type Name = String
-- | a value is either
data Value = NUM Number -- ^ a number (currently floats only)
           | CAT Category -- ^ a category (bin name in a histogram)
           | MAP [(Field, Value)] -- ^ a record 
instance Show Value where
  show (NUM n) = show n
  show (CAT c) = show c
  show (MAP fvs) = concat ["{", (concat . intersperse ", ") (map (\(f, v) -> f ++ " = " ++ show v) fvs), "}"]

type Number = Double
type Category = String

-- | supported statistical operators
data OPR = SUM -- ^ sum 2 numbers
         | CONCAT -- ^ concatinate 2 categories
instance Show OPR where
  show SUM = "+"
  show CONCAT = "*"
